detaileddescription.para: Gets the singleton instance - this is a function pointer that points to one of the below two instance calls. Note that it is not a member function pointer since it is a static function. the function pointer swapping is valid as long as the initial calls only happen from the main thread.

briefdescription.para: Number of threads currently running. Accessed thru multiple threads.
Maximum number of threads allowed out.
Gets the singleton instance.
Gets the singleton instance.
Kills the ODMananger Thread.
sets a flag that is set if we have loaded some OD blockfiles from PCM.
resets a flag that is set if we have loaded some OD blockfiles from PCM.
returns a flag that is set if we have loaded some OD blockfiles from PCM.
returns whether or not the singleton instance was created yet
changes the tasks associated with this Waveform to process the task from a different point in the track

detaileddescription.para:
changes the tasks associated with this Waveform to process the task from a different point in the track
track
the track to update
seconds
the point in the track from which the tasks associated with track should begin processing from.

briefdescription.para: Reduces the count of current threads running. Meant to be called when ODTaskThreads end in their own threads. Thread-safe.
Adds a wavetrack, creates a queue member.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a NEW task to the queue. Creates a queue if the tracks associated with the task is not in the list

parameterdescription.para: locks the mutexes if true (default). This function is used within other ODManager calls, which many need to set this to false.

briefdescription.para: Wakes the queue loop up by signalling its condition variable.
removes a wavetrack and notifies its associated tasks to stop using its reference.
if it shares a queue/task, creates a NEW queue/task for the track, and removes it from any previously existing tasks.

detaileddescription.para: attach the track in question to another, already existing track's queues and tasks. Remove the task/tracks. Returns success if it was possible.. Some ODTask conditions make it impossible until the Tasks finish.

attach the track in question to another, already existing track's queues and tasks. Remove the task/tracks. only works if both tracks exist. Sets needODUpdate flag for the task. This is complicated and will probably need better design in the future.
returns success. Some ODTask conditions require that the tasks finish before merging. e.g. they have different effects being processed at the same time.

briefdescription.para: replace the wavetrack whose wavecache the gui watches for updates
Adds a task to the running queue. Threas-safe.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a task to running queue. Thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: removes a task from the active task queue
fills in the status bar message for a given track
Gets the total percent complete for all tasks combined.
Get Total Number of Tasks.
Launches a thread for the manager and starts accepting Tasks.
Start the main loop for the manager.

detaileddescription.para: Main loop for managing threads and tasks.

briefdescription.para: Remove references in our array to Tasks that have been completed/Schedule NEW ones.

detaileddescription.para: remove tasks from ODWaveTrackTaskQueues that have been done. Schedules NEW ones if they exist Also remove queues that have become empty.

briefdescription.para: A singleton that manages currently running Tasks on an arbitrary number of threads.
